intro: Draba mollis, commonly known as the slender whitlow grass, is a small flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arctic regions. The plant has basal leaves that are linear and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, yellowish flowers in late spring. Draba mollis is part of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinct four-petaled flowers. It is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
